intro: Corybas caudatus, commonly known as the long-tailed hooded orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to parts of Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, hood-shaped flower that often has a long, slender spur. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests and undergrowth. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow to brownish in color, and it produces small, dark brown seeds. Corybas caudatus is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is known for its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
